alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 18 at 4:21AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: .Moderate to heavy rainfall over the south slopes of the Olympics combined with snow melt could lead to flooding on the Skokomish River. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Washington, including the following county, Mason. * WHEN...Through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall of 2 to 3 inches over the south slopes of the Olympic mountains, along with rising snow levels. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
